intro: Scleria suaveolens, commonly known as sweet-scented sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to brown in color. Scleria suaveolens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
